result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E Ferraro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Surcharge to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 01-01-2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 16 days in jail consecutive for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
The Defendant is not to use or possess THC or serve 30 day jail for penalty.
To be completed within 1 year.  If the Defendant files proof of completion prior to review date of 12-02-16, the date will be removed from the calendar.

6/16/2017 - COMMUNITY SERVICE NOT COMPLETED.  COURT IMPOSES PENALTY OF 30 DAYS JAIL, CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

6/26/2017 - COURT GRANTS HUBER PRIVILEGES ON PENALTY FOR NOT COMPLETING COMMUNITY SERVICE.

7/10/2017 - COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR DEFENDANT TO SERVE 30 DAYS JAIL IN RACINE COUNTY FOR NOT COMPLETING COMMUNITY SERVICE.

Defendant Steven E Ferraro in court, in custody and by video from Racine County Jail.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicates he has not completed 100 hours of community service.  Court imposes the alternate and orders 30 days jail consecutive to any other sentence.
Bail/bond hearing on June 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Order for withdrawl as counsel of record signed by Judge Aprahamian 6/5/17.
Upon return on warrant the Defendant is to serve the alternate of 30 days jail ordered by the Court.

Defendant Steven E Ferraro not in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not appear, case was set for 9:00, case was called at 9:21 a.m.  Based on defendant's non appearance,  Court issues capias. Upon return on warrant defendant to serve the ordered alternate of 30 days jail.
Letter from Atty. Schiro requesting appearance be excused
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 6/2/17 received and filed.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 6/5/17.
Review hearing on June 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven E Ferraro in court with attorney John Jenson for John Scott Schiro.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jensen advises the Court the Defendant has not completed any of the court ordered community service and requests the Court grant an extension to complete the community service.  The Court grants the request and grants an extension of 6 months.  The Court advises the Defendant if he does not complete the community service the court will impose a 30 days jail sentence.  Review hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

From WCS dated 11/28/16 re defendant's failure to complete community service.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 11/29/16.
Review hearing on December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing at 12-02-2016 08:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steven E Ferraro in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant is sentenced as follows: FINE: $583.75. DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (both fine and DNA surcharge to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 1/1/16 or serve 16 days jail consecutive as penalty for nonpayment.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  Perform 100 hours community service to be completed within one year.  The Defendant is not to use or possess THC or serve 30 days jail as penalty. The Court set the matter for a review hearing in approximately one year to address completion of community service.  If the Defendant files proof of completion prior to the review date the date will be removed from the Courts calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-01-2015 08:15 am
